intro: Lastrea pilosohispida, commonly known as the hairy hispid lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a delicate touch to its succulent foliage. Its hairy texture helps reduce water loss, making it well adapted to arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
